1.content:
"Anon, we need someone just like you to really start taking this company forward." your boss said, putting his arm around as he walked you down the hall.

"Th-thank you, sir. That really does mean a lot that you'd say that."

"Of course, this company is already pretty much as forward it could go right now, I mean, have you seen how much money we make? Spoiler: it's a lot!" he continued, apparently having not heard your humble response.

"Ha ha, um, well, I'm sure I have what it takes to make even more of that money, sir."

"That's not what we need, Anon. Hyperion is just a giant money printer these days! We don't need men who can boost income; we just need men who can prove they want to be here more than anyone else. Can you do that?" he continued to drape his arm over your shoulder, leading you into his office.

"Of course."

"Good! Because I'm sending you away." he sat at his desk and motioned for you to take a seat.

"Away, sir? Where?" you ask, sitting down as instructed.

"Pandora." he waved his hands in a jazzy manner as to spruce up the name of the dive he was sending you to. "Shit hole of a planet, but, we got some guys down there running some experiments on a substance the locals have taken to calling 'slag.'"

"And you want me to go down there and oversee their work? Make sure everything is running effiently and everyone is working hard?"

"Never assume, Anon. Never assume. They need a new guy to replace a failed test from last week and I told them to get the hell outta my office. But then I remembered you and figured 'hey, if the kid wants work.'"

"I, um-- look, with all due respect, sir, I was kind of hoping for a job that was more on the management side of things..."

"Anon. You've got to prove you want to be a manager before you can start becoming a manager. Understand?"

You didn't.

"I understand."

"Good. Now get the hell outta my office."

-------------------------------------------------------------

Thinking back on that conversation, you wish you'd just told him you were happy with your current job. Maybe then you wouldn't currently be sat in a giant test tube, with a bunch of giant people walking around you.

As it so happened, the slag experiment you were the subject for involved testing the size changing capabilities of slag. The scientists had heard of beasts growing in size after exposure to slag and they were curious as to what would happen if a human were to be injected with the same type of slag. Severe shrinkage was the result.

You'd been kept at your current size, two and a half inches, for about 3 days now. There was talk of maybe making you smaller but they concluded that they'd gathered all the information they could from your shrinking. Maybe you'll be getting that promotion sooner that you'd expected.

One of the scientists was making his way over to you when an engineer came rushing in covered in blood. Everyone stopped what they were doing immediately, shifting their attention to the blood soaked man catching his breath.

"It's--" the engineer was cut off by a large purple orb that lifted him a few feet off the ground and set him ablaze.

"SIREN!!" one man shouted as everyone made their retreat.

"Hey, wait! Don't leave me!!" you screamed after them, banging on the glass of your prison.

Gunshots echoed from the hallway, growing louder by the second. Bullets flew through the doorway, incapacitating the fleeing scientists. You curled into a ball, preying a stray bullet wouldn't find you and tear you to absolute shreds. You'd been warned about the abundance of firearms on Pandora but you never assumed you'd come anywhere near any kind of combat. If you'd known you'd be under the threat of sirens and bullets the size of you, you'd have told your manager to fuck off since day one. Is this really how your life is going to end?

After what seemed like an eternity of gunfire and screams and murder, everything went quiet. You summoned the courage to stand up and see the damage that had been done. You wished you hadn't once you saw all the bodies lying around. Almost everyone in the facility had been killed. You felt bad for the poor men who clocked in this morning with no intention of being gunned down in the middle of their shift.

As you looked stunned at the aftermath of the chaos that had ensued, you noticed a blue haired woman walk through the door that was recently spitting out bullets. She wandered around, putting bullets in the heads of some scientists who hadn't quite succumbed to their injuries yet.

"Why waste the bullets?" a voice coming from the door said. As you looked over, a younger woman walked in, possibly in her late teens. You noticed she had a robot arm but not much else grabbed your attention about her.

"What separates us from the rest of the scum on Pandora, Gaige?" The blue haired girl asked, continuing to finish the barely living survivors. The girl, now confirmed to be Gaige, thought for a second.

"We... have bigger guns?"

"We're proffesionals. We don't just unload our weapons into a crowd and leave. We make sure every kill is clean. No unnecessary suffering."

"But they're Hyperion. I say let them bleed."

You gulped as Gaige revealed her hatred for the company you represent.

"Remind me why you came with me." the siren said, visibly annoyed at Gaige's running commentary.

"I'unno. Bored. Everybody was off doing stuff and then you went off to go do stuff and I figured 'Hey! Stuff!' so I came along."

"Uh-huh."

"Plus, look at all this stuff!" Gaige added as she tinkered with a generator. "Say what you want about Hyperion, love 'em or hate 'em, but, they have some cool tech! Wonder if any of it can be salvaged... Maya! Help me with this!" Gaige struggled to rip out some sort of battery.

"No. Waste of time. Tannis said she wanted whatever they were working on here and that's it." Maya instructed. That didn't sound good. You weren't the only thing they were working on here but you were probably the most interesting. This did not bode well for you.

"Fiiine." Gaige sighed, retiring her efforts. She started sifting through paper and checking desks for the fabled experiment. You looked around desperately for a way to escape your glass prison but saw nothing. All you could do was sit and wait as the two giant women grew closer to your position with each terrifying step. What would they do to you? Who is this 'Tannis' person and what do they want you for?

You considered how you would play it when they eventually found you. Would you be cool and collected? "Hi, I'm the experiment. What is it you need?" Or maybe suave and charismatic? "Ladies, search no more for your answer finds you in one neatly wrapped, handsome package. Anon's the name, pleasing ladies is the game."

As you fantasised the many ways in which you could introduce yourself, a giant face came into your view, scaring you witless.

"Oh my god! Help!!" ...or you could play it scared and pathetic.

"Is this it?" the giant face of Gaige called over to the other titan. Maya came over and you found yourself looking up at two gigantic, albeit pretty, faces.

"I... think so??"

"It asked for help."

Maya tapped the glass, shaking your entire world. "Hey, you. Tiny person. Are you the slag experiment?"

You considered saying no but chances are that would lead to these two either leaving you here to rot or simply killing you. You opted for the long term decision.

"Yes. They were experimenting on me to see the size changing capabili--" your tube was lifted with immense speed and carried away with you inside.

"I heard yes." Maya said as she attached you to her belt.
1.title: Welcome to Pandora

11.content:
Your journey to this town called 'Sanctuary' was a bumpy ride. You were still attached to Maya's belt as she drove you and Gaige across the desert in some sort of dune-buggy. You were unclipped from the belt once you entered the border of Santuary and Maya tossed you to Gaige who almost didn't catch you.

You were taken into a small building where a lady with short hair and goggles sat waiting at her desk.

"Vault Hunters, you return! Did you get me something nice?"

"Sure did!" Gaige's chirped as she handed you over to the lady who must be Tannis. She held your glass cage close up to her face to examine you, making her eyes look huge.

"He's a slag experiment Hyperion were working on. I assume they want to use slag to shrink people for whatever reason." Maya elaborated.

"Does he know anything?" Tannis asked.

"Ask him yourself."

Tannis opened the top of your test tube and slowly tip it over. You slid down and landed on the table with a dull thud. Unsure of what to do with your new found 'freedom', you decided to stay put and look up at Tannis.

"Well..?" she started, "What are they trying to learn from you?" she leaned in closer with curiosity lighting a fire in her eyes. You were torn between melting at how cute that would be at normal size, or screaming at how scary it is at your current size.

"I-I really have no idea. I was just told I'd get a promotion if I went through with it..." you waited to see if your answer was good enough for her and she picked you up and started twiddling you around in her fingers.

"Now, why would Hyperion need to shrink people? Weaponising slag has already been established so they don't stand much profit from adding a shrinking element, though that would be fascinating, so maybe they aren't looking to shrink enemies but perhaps... allies? Smaller employees means they can fit more workers in their space stations, this allows for more work to be done and thus higher efficiency..." her ramblings continued as you were flung about and fiddled with between the giant dork's long fingers. You tried to wriggle free but you were already starting to get a feel for just how weak you are at your new size.

After what felt like hours, you were released and you let yourself drop to your hands and knees. Tannis had stopped speaking which allowed Maya to finally get a word in. She plucked you off the table and dangled you infront of her face. You looked down at the ground miles beneath you.

"Put me down!! What's wrong with you?!"

"Did you say a promotion?" Maya asked.

"What? Y-yeah, my boss said I had to volunteer for--" Maya interrupted you abruptly yet again, dropping you back on the table and pinning you down with her hand.

"He works for Hyperion. He can't stay here. He'll tell Hyperion about everything he hears."

"I won't!" you tried to shout up to them from under Maya's palm.

"True. But that doesn't mean he can't stay." Tannis started, "It just means he can't leave."

"Go on..."

"There is still much to learn from our new found tiny friend here. It would be a waste to end his life here and now, especially after the trouble the two of you went through to get him, so someone needs to watch him to ensure he doesn't escape."

"Not it." Maya and Gaige say in unison.

"I wasn't asking for volunteers. And I already had someone in mind..." Tannis said, taking you from under Maya's hand. You gasped for some much needed fresh air.

"Who?" Maya asked.
11.title: To Sanctuary...

choices: You are dropped and lost in the bar

114.title: "Moxxi."

1151.content:
"I believe Ellie's garage in the Dust would be the best place for him."

"You want to leave him with Ellie? The single most dangerous woman in the Dust?" Maya questioned.

"I thought she was the only woman in the Dust." Gaige deadpanned.

"Ellie's psyche profile doesn't match that of a capable caregiver, this is true, but her garage is secluded. Far away from Sanctuary. So, if Mr. Hyperion here should find some way to contact his employer, he won't have any info on us to dish out if he returns. Plus, I checked and there is not a single soul on Pandora with an ounce of motherly instinct so Ellie will simply put the most fear into him. Now go away, I'll pay you when you return, you know the drill."

You surprised yourself with how much you actually paid attention to there. Normally, you zone out when people talk more than three sentences to you but it's probably a bit different when the topic is literally who might kill you by the end of today.

God, you wish this could be over today.

Maya put you back in the tube and clipped you to her belt. She made off alone this time in the dune-buggy-like contraption and began to drive.

————————————

The drive lasted hours. Tannis wasn't kidding when she said it was far away. The scorching sun turned your tube into an oven and passed out a couple of times on the way here. The engines rumbling came to a halt along with the car. Maya hopped out and drew her pistol. This worried you. Why would she need to be armed and ready if this Ellie was an ally. Your question was quickly answered.

"Git on the ground now before I fill your head with buckshot." a voice ordered from behind. Maya turned around slowly.

"It's me."

"Oh, heeeey, girly! What brings you all the way out here? Sorry about the whole shotgun thing. I mean, you look like a Siren from behind and all but that's how they get you, man - overconfidence - one minute I'm looking at a beautiful Siren, she turns around and BOOM! Bandit. Or family come down to stay for the week. Either way I gotta have my finger on that trigger. I'm working on it, promise."

"It's fine. I actually came to ask you a favour. We need you to keep an eye on a Hyperion prisoner."

"That may just be my new favourite sentence! Where is the bastard? Tied to the front of the car? Niiiice. You want me to rough 'em up a bit? Maybe pull a couple teeth? Or maybe I could--"

"THIS. Is him..." Maya held up the tube containing you. Ellie quickly swiped it to check you out.

"It's tiny."

"He was part of a test. It's a long story. All I'm asking you to do is make sure he stays here. Can you do that?"

"Did that Tannis lady shrink 'em? 'Cause I wouldn't put it past her, that bitch is craaay-zee. You know this one time she shot--"

"Ellie. Can you do that?"

"Sure I can, girl, don't you worry your pretty little head you just go right on back and tell Tannis I've got it covered. Go on, git!" Ellie shooed Maya over to her car. "And drive careful." She called as Maya sped off. She sighed as the dust cleared. "I do worry about those kids... NOW!!" She tossed you up in the air and caught you, "let's begin, shall we?"

You were carried into the garage. The mattress on the floor in the corner suggested that Ellie might sleep here too. You wondered how one would even sleep in a place like this. The all too apparent lack of doors and windows means that anyone could sneak in and put a bullet in your head while you slept. You shivered at the thought of sleeping tonight. Would you be forced to share a bed with this gigantic tank of a woman? Would you even last until the evening in her clutches?

"How do you open this thing?" Ellie wondered out a loud.

"Oh, there's a--" your attempt at helpfulness was cut off by a sudden increase of speed. Time seemed to slow down enough to realise what was happening. Ellie was just going to smash it! You braced for impact in whatever fraction of a second you had left before you were laid out on the table surrounded by shards of glass.

"There we go!"

"Oh my god! You're insane! I could've died!" you turned around to face the enormous woman. God she was big. Even if you were normal size she'd probably terrify you.

Ellie flicked you across the table. "Don't you talk to me unless I speak first. Got that?"

You stayed silent as you stood up.

"I asked you a question. Got. That?"

You stayed silent. Mostly because the impact of her plump fingers had winded you a little.

"You're gonna answer me. Now." she primed her fingers to flick you again and you hit the deck cowering in fear.

"No, please!!" She put her face close up to you. You could feel her breath hot on your back.

"Got. That?"

"Yes! Yes! Fuck, just don't hurt me!"

"That's good. Otherwise I'd have to just kill you now and all my fun would be wasted."

Wait. Does she mean she's going to kill you anyway? And what fun does she plan on having with you? For the fourth time in one day, you feared for your life. You had to get away from this woman. Right now.

You ran as fast as your shaky legs would carry you but you only made it a few steps before a gigantic fist came crashing down infront of you.

"I wouldn't do that if I were you." Ellie picked you up and squeezed you tight in her first. "I've crushed men who were five hundred times the size you are. You don't want to piss me off. Is that understood?"

The force of her fist made it hard to breathe, but you managed to answer her.
1151.title: "Ellie."

1152.content:
"Tiny Tina." Tannis declared.
"Tiny Tina!?!" The two Vault hunters said in surprised unison.
This did not calm you down. If two Vault hunters are uneasy about your soon-to-be Warren, you figure despite the name, the person in question must be an absolute psychopath, torturing out all the Intel (and you had a lot of intel, despite being a low-level hyperion employee (after all, you and John, I mean..."Handsome Jack", dreamed of ruling Hyperion, Pandora, Hell, the whole universe, with your childhood friend. Only to have him put some Pandoran hash in your employee locker, forcing you to start at the very bottom again. Turns out, his password to his Helios account was his daughter's name, and the secrets you've seen...))
"Please! I'll tell you what little I know! Just please don't have this Tiny Tina person!"
Maya and Gaige said in unison, this time more sinister and approving. "TINY TINA!"
"Good. Glad we all can agree on someone. Now, you two, off to relocate our new..."asset", to his new location. Chop Chop!" Tannis ordered.
"Yes ma'am." Maya replied, as she grabbed you and put you back in your glass prison of a test tube, then clipping your prison to her belt, on the front of her right hip.
"I'll drive!" Gaige said enthusiastically.
"Hell.No. Last time you drove, we almost drove off the The Dust." Maya snapped.
"That was two weeks ago." Gaige defended.
"That was twenty hours ago." Maya replied.
"Can I at least be in charge of the prisoner?" She pleaded.
"NO!" You and the Siren said in unison.
1152.title: "Tiny Tina."

Tina, we're here to hand over this hyperion bug to you so you can..." Maya started to say.

"Well, our work hear is done. C'mon Gaige. Time to go." Maya said after handing you to the 13 year old.
"Bye Tina! See you next week for tea and crumpets!" Gaige waved goodbye.
"Bye Gaige! Bye Maya! Don't forget to bring me some of Moxie's pizza, or I'll make spaghetti with your intestines! Tina waved back with the same hand she held you in, causing you to be shooken around. After the Vault hunters left, you stood face to face with the most dangerous 13 year old.

info.brief_description: Ain't no rest for the tiny...
info.description:
This story takes place on Pandora; home to thieves, bandits, murderers, cannibals, con men, shotgun-wielding midgets, midget-wielding psychopaths and any other kind of scum you can imagine.

Your name is Anon. You were a lowly Hyperion employee until you were offered the oppurtunity to finally develop your career! You'd been waiting for this promotion ever since you landed your shitty job and that promotion would come to you on one condition; you volunteer yourself for some slag experimentation going on in the labs down on the surface of Pandora.

But what's a couple tests on some wasteland of a planet for a few days compared to the promotion you'd been dreaming of for years?!

Welcome to Pandora, kiddo.
